intro: Hibiscus caesius var. genuinus, commonly known as the Ethiopian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Hibiscus caesius var. genuinus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
